item.title: Video: How cops cleared 1,000 vehicle jam in Himachal Pradesh - Hindustan Times
item.description:
How Police Rescued Tourists from a Major Traffic Jam in Himachal Pradesh

Himachal Pradesh faced severe traffic congestion with 1,000 vehicles stranded near Solang Nala due to heavy snowfall and an influx of tourists. Kullu police successfully rescued around 5,000 stranded tourists in a continuous operation.

“Due to fresh snowfall today on 27.12.2024, about 1,000 tourists and other vehicles were stuck in Solang Nala.” - Kullu Police

This event highlights the challenges faced by local authorities during peak tourist seasons impacted by extreme weather conditions.

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned BRS leader and former Telangana minister KT Rama Rao regarding financial irregularities tied to the Formula E race in Hyderabad.

item.title: Govt agreed to memorial for Manmohan Singh, Congress now playing politics: BJP - The Hindu
item.description:
BJP Accuses Congress of Playing Politics Over Memorial for Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: December 28, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has announced its decision to construct a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh while accusing the Congress party of politicizing the issue.

  • The BJP stated that it is committed to honoring Manmohan Singh’s contributions to India's economic development.
  • A memorial and mausoleum will be built in his memory, a decision that was communicated to Congress leadership prior.
  • The Congress has claimed it wanted Manmohan Singh's cremation to take place at a location suitable for a memorial, but the ceremony occurred at Nigambodh Ghat.
  • BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized Congress for their perceived lack of respect towards Singh.
“Congress party, who never respected Dr. Manmohan Singh in their lifetime, today even after his death, they are seen doing politics.” - Sudhanshu Trivedi

The BJP insists that the memorial will be built following necessary legal protocols, reinforcing their commitment to respecting Singh's legacy.

item.title: ‘Utter rubbish…’: Pranab Mukherjee's daughter Sharmistha slams Congress amid Manmohan Singh memorial row - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over Memorial Controversy for Manmohan Singh

Date: Dec 28, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Sharmistha Mukherjee, daughter of former president Pranab Mukherjee, criticized the Congress party for not convening a Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting after her father’s death in 2020, while supporting a request for a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Sharmistha stated the Congress didn’t hold a CWC meeting after Pranab Mukherjee's passing.
  • She referenced diary entries showing that a CWC meeting was held for K.R. Narayanan's passing.
  • Despite criticism, she supports a memorial for Manmohan Singh, who passed away at 92.
“When baba passed away, Congress didnt even bother 2 call CWC 4 condolence meeting. That’s utter rubbish...” - Sharmistha Mukherjee

In conclusion, Sharmistha Mukherjee’s remarks highlight ongoing tensions within the Congress party regarding how it honors its leaders, contrasted with her support for a memorial for Manmohan Singh.

item.title: Snowfall paints Kashmir white - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Snowfall Paints Kashmir White

Date: December 27, 2022

Source: Greater Kashmir

The recent snowfall in Kashmir has delighted locals and tourists alike, marking the end of a prolonged dry spell. However, it has also caused significant disruptions to traffic and air travel.

  • Kashmir received its first snowfall of the season, affecting Srinagar and various districts.
  • Traffic disruptions were reported on major routes, including the Srinagar-Jammu National Highway.
  • Seven flights were cancelled at Srinagar International Airport due to heavy snow and low visibility.
  • The Meteorological Department predicted continued snowfall in higher altitudes.

  • Local authorities are advising caution due to potential landslides and slippery conditions on roads.
“I drove from Jammu to Srinagar today. It snowed continuously from Banihal to Srinagar. The conditions were quite treacherous.” - Omar Abdullah, Chief Minister

This significant snowfall has not only brought joy for winter tourism but also presents challenges for infrastructure and safety on the roads.

Manmohan Singh’s funeral at Nigambodh ghat, Congress calls it deliberate insult to first Sikh PM

Published on: December 27, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Ministry of Home Affairs has ordered a State funeral for former Prime Minister Dr Manmohan Singh at Nigambodh Ghat, which has sparked controversy with the Congress party calling it a deliberate insult to Singh's legacy.

  • Dr Manmohan Singh passed away at the age of 92.
  • The Congress demanded a funeral location suitable for a memorial.
  • The decision for Nigambodh Ghat was made after discussions between Congress leaders and government officials.
  • Senior Congress leaders expressed that the choice of location is viewed as disrespectful.

The government's decision has sparked a broader discussion about how national leaders are honored in death and the significance of memorials for their contributions.

item.title: 'No One Should Blame Girl For Being With Male Friend': Madras HC Orally Remarks In Plea For CBI Probe... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Madras High Court Emphasizes Victim's Rights in Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Madras High Court heard pleas for a CBI probe into the sexual assault of a student at Anna University, stressing that victims should not be blamed for the circumstances surrounding their assault.

  • The court clarified that no one should blame the victim for being with her boyfriend during the incident.
  • It criticized the State Government for leaking the FIR and emphasized the need for privacy and respect for victims.
  • The court raised concerns about campus security, pointing out that many surveillance cameras were non-functional at the time of the incident.
  • There were questions regarding the legality of the police commissioner’s remarks about the investigation status.
  • The case has significant implications regarding the accountability of law enforcement and university authorities.
“Just because this incident has happened, no one should blame the girl for sitting with her boyfriend. It is her private right.”

The court's remarks reflect a growing awareness of victim rights and the importance of privacy in legal proceedings, while also demanding higher accountability from law enforcement and educational institutions.

  • Capt. Floyd Gracious and Neeraj Bhatia are suspended and must be replaced by suitable candidates.
  • Previous fines and penalties for Akasa Air indicate ongoing compliance issues.
The DGCA noted that the airline's response to earlier violations was unsatisfactory.

This suspension highlights the ongoing scrutiny faced by Akasa Air concerning pilot training and operational compliance.

item.title: Delhi pollution: CAQM revokes GRAP 3 measures as rain improves air quality - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Pollution: CAQM Revokes GRAP 3 Measures as Rain Improves Air Quality

Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi's air pollution levels showed a declining trend, prompting the Centre's anti-pollution panel to revoke Stage 3 curbs under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) due to improved air quality brought on by rain.

  • The 24-hour average air quality index (AQI) was 324 at 7 PM.
  • CAQM stated that air quality shifted from 'severe' to 'poor', allowing the withdrawal of Stage 3 measures.
  • Stage 1 and 2 measures will remain in effect to prevent further deterioration.
  • The significant impact of rain is expected to continue improving air quality in the city.
  • GRAP Stage 3 included bans on non-essential construction, hybrid schooling for younger students, and restrictions on certain vehicles.
"Delhi's air quality has shifted from the 'severe' category to the 'poor' range. As a result, measures under Stage III, implemented earlier, are now being withdrawn." - CAQM

In conclusion, the recent rainfall in Delhi has led to a notable improvement in air quality, prompting authorities to ease certain pollution control measures while maintaining vigilance to ensure continued air quality management.

item.title: Madras High Court Takes Suo Motu Cognizance Of Alleged Sexual Assault Of Student At Anna University - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Madras High Court Takes Suo Motu Cognizance Of Alleged Sexual Assault Of Student At Anna University

Publication Date: December 27, 2023

Source: Madras High Court

The Madras High Court has taken cognizance of the alleged sexual assault of a second-year engineering student at Anna University in Chennai, following a letter from Advocate R Varalakshmi.

  • The incident happened on December 23 when the accused allegedly recorded a video of the girl and her male friend before assaulting her.
  • The bench noted the need for procedural adherence before action can be taken and awaits formal orders from the Chief Justice.
  • The Advocate General assured the court that the state would file a status report on the investigation.
  • Concerns have been raised regarding campus safety and the history of the accused, who has previous sexual assault cases against him.
  • The National Commission for Women has also responded, calling for stricter punishments related to leakage of FIR details.
“We've made an attempt to get orders from the Chief Justice...There's a procedure to be followed. So we'll have to wait for the official orders,” said the court.

The court's reaction highlights the ongoing issues surrounding campus security and the legal processes to ensure justice and safety for students.

item.title: China defends plan to build world's largest dam over Brahmaputra River in Tibet - Hindustan Times
item.description:
China Defends the Construction of the World's Largest Dam Over the Brahmaputra River

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Chinese foreign ministry announced plans for a $137 billion dam on the Brahmaputra River in Tibet, asserting that it will not adversely affect neighboring countries along the river.

  • The dam is part of a major infrastructure project in the ecologically sensitive Himalayan region.
  • China claims it has conducted extensive studies to ensure the project's safety and environmental impact.
  • Work on the dam aims to foster international cooperation on disaster prevention and relief.
  • Construction will take at least a decade and will connect to the grid further east.
  • Concerns have been raised about potential water flow reductions affecting downstream countries, especially India.
“Everybody downstream is going to be concerned about what it means if water flow is reduced. I know India is very anxious about it.” - David Fishman, energy consulting firm

This ambitious project highlights the complexities of managing international rivers and the geopolitical implications for neighboring nations.

item.title: Madras High Court slams TN Police for leaking FIR copy of Anna University sexual assault - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Madras High Court Criticizes Police for FIR Leak in Anna University Assault Case

Published on: 27 Dec 2024, 12:59 pm

The Madras High Court has condemned the Chennai Police for leaking the identity of a 19-year-old student who was assaulted at Anna University, questioning the implications for the victim's family and the broader chilling effect on victims coming forward.

  • The Court expressed concern over the police's failure to redact the victim's identity in the FIR.
  • Justice SM Subramaniam emphasized that the negligence could deter future victims from approaching law enforcement.
  • The incident involved the arrest of a biryani vendor accused of sexually assaulting the student on December 23.
  • The Court is demanding answers from the police regarding lapses and the portrayal of the investigation's status.
  • Concerns were raised over the operational capacity of CCTV cameras at the university during the incident.
“You can upload the FIR but you are supposed to redact identity details. The damage caused to the victim and her family can't be taken back by you.”

The Court's remarks reflect a critical stance towards systemic issues in handling sexual assault cases, emphasizing the need for accountability and protective measures for victims.
